ticket.title: attr_accesor_with_default alias reader method
ticket.original-body:
@@@ attr_accessor_with_default :something_processed, false alias_method :something_processed?, :something_processed @@@
seems to be a problem because the reader looks like it is redefined on line 26 in "attr_accessor_with_default.rb" @@@ class << self; attr_reader :#{sym} end # class << self; attr_reader :age end @@@
@@@ x = Blubb.new x.something_processed # => false x.something_processed? # => false x.something_processed = true # => true x.something_processed # => true x.something_processed? # => false @@@
imho the last line should also return true
i'm sorry if that behavior is how it's intended
ticket.latest-body:
@@@ attr_accessor_with_default :something_processed, false alias_method :something_processed?, :something_processed @@@
seems to be a problem because the reader looks like it is redefined on line 26 in "attr_accessor_with_default.rb" @@@ class << self; attr_reader :#{sym} end # class << self; attr_reader :age end @@@
@@@ x = Blubb.new x.something_processed # => false x.something_processed? # => false x.something_processed = true # => true x.something_processed # => true x.something_processed? # => false @@@
imho the last line should also return true
i'm sorry if that behavior is how it's intended
ticket.original-body-html:
attr_accessor_with_default :something_processed, false
alias_method :something_processed?, :something_processed

seems to be a problem because the reader looks like it is redefined on line 26 in "attr_accessor_with_default.rb"

class << self; attr_reader :#{sym} end  #   class << self; attr_reader :age end

x = Blubb.new
x.something_processed        # => false
x.something_processed?       # => false
x.something_processed = true # => true
x.something_processed        # => true
x.something_processed?       # => false

imho the last line should also return true

i'm sorry if that behavior is how it's intended

@@@ x = Blubb.new x.something_processed # => false x.something_processed? # => false x.something_processed = true # => true x.something_processed # => true x.something_processed? # => false @@@

version.body: A thousand-li journey is started by taking the first step.Strength alone knows conflict, weakness is below even defeat, and is born vanquished. It's an ugg classic cardy tall article by Tom Reese in yesterday's Pacific Northwest Magazine about the Lake Washington wetlands near Seattle's Arboretum. I actually found myself ugg boots classic cardy gray strangely upset by the article. Not only because he's describing a place I've loved for ugg boots years, but because he so carefully describes the official ugg boots contingency of the natural environment there.Reese takes the bailey ugg boots uk pied-billed grebe as his touchstone, which is a good choice. If you know where to look, you can find the grebe's nest classic argyle uggs resting on the lily pads. It's exposed. It trusts to camoflauge to avoid disturbance. And the argyle ugg boots uk grebes there always make me worry because they're so small and tentative, with ugg boots shop so little to defend themselves. They're the perfect metaphor for our mini ugg boots stewardship of the natural refuges in our cities.Plus, the seventeen photos that mini ugg boots on sale accompany the article online are also astonishingly good. Much better than ordinary uggs ultra boots on sale newspaper shots. But you should go see for yourself.In this article, the good Vietnamese monk tells the story of counseling a young Buddhist woman who had fallen in love with a Catholic man, and was distraught because his family was insisting that she become a Catholic in ultra tall uggs order to marry him. After speaking with her, Thich Nhat Hanh basically gave his ugg classic tall purple blessing for her to enter the church, suggesting that if she continued ugg tall red to do mindfulness work, she could be a Buddhist on the ugg boots cheap inside, even while practicing Catholicism. She thought it over, and her reply is worth considering, as she short black uggs weighs the merits of the two faiths: “[Buddhism is] a tradition that is so embracing, so discount ugg boots classic short tolerant, so open, if I abandon it and turn my back to it, I am not a person of value. [By contrast, Catholicism is] a tradition sundance uggs on sale that is so strict, that has no tolerance, that is not able to understand, how could I formally identify myself sundance uggs sand with it?” ZHC

I actually found myself ugg boots classic cardy gray strangely upset by the article. Not only because he's describing a place I've loved for ugg boots years, but because he so carefully describes the official ugg boots contingency of the natural environment there.Reese takes the bailey ugg boots uk pied-billed grebe as his touchstone, which is a good choice. If you know where to look, you can find the grebe's nest classic argyle uggs resting on the lily pads. It's exposed. It trusts to camoflauge to avoid disturbance. And the argyle ugg boots uk grebes there always make me worry because they're so small and tentative, with ugg boots shop so little to defend themselves. They're the perfect metaphor for our mini ugg boots stewardship of the natural refuges in our cities.Plus, the seventeen photos that mini ugg boots on sale accompany the article online are also astonishingly good. Much better than ordinary uggs ultra boots on sale newspaper shots. But you should go see for yourself.In this article, the good Vietnamese monk tells the story of counseling a young Buddhist woman who had fallen in love with a Catholic man, and was distraught because his family was insisting that she become a Catholic in ultra tall uggs order to marry him. After speaking with her, Thich Nhat Hanh basically gave his ugg classic tall purple blessing for her to enter the church, suggesting that if she continued ugg tall red to do mindfulness work, she could be a Buddhist on the ugg boots cheap inside, even while practicing Catholicism. She thought it over, and her reply is worth considering, as she short black uggs weighs the merits of the two faiths: “[Buddhism is] a tradition that is so embracing, so discount ugg boots classic short tolerant, so open, if I abandon it and turn my back to it, I am not a person of value. [By contrast, Catholicism is] a tradition sundance uggs on sale that is so strict, that has no tolerance, that is not able to understand, how could I formally identify myself sundance uggs sand with it?” ZHC
version.title: attr_accesor_with_default alias reader method

version.body-html:
@bhu, it is indeed odd and I can reproduce this behavior.

I don't think it was not how it was intended but unfortunately this is how the functionality got implemented.
The writer redefines the reader to clear out the default.

I wish it was written a bit more cleanly such that reader and writers were only defined once.

something like (pseudocode)

  def sym=(value)
    @sym_marked = true
    @sym = value
  end
  def sym
    @sym_marked ? @sym : default_value # default_value would return the default value or invoke the block
  end

Feel free to implement and patch.
version.title: attr_accesor_with_default alias reader method

version.body:
Here my latest version in case of tagging. https://gist.github.com/748873 Hopefully you can tell me what i did wrong.
I hope you like the solution with the additional method.
If there are any problems please inform me. First ticket so i don't really know if i did everything right.
The "(@sym_marked ||= false)" is just to get rid of uninitialized variable warning.

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
